channel.title: Google News
channel.description: A scraped RSS feed for the Google News En Telegram Channel

item.title: 2023-06-06T13:08:53
item.description:
Google Calendar app will receive updated Material You widgets.

The last time the widgets were redesigned was in October 2021, and at the time it was hard to call it a redesign, as they simply got rounded corners and dynamic colors. However, this is about to change.

The latest version of the app, numbered 2023.22.1-537255951, has a new hidden flag, "Gm3Widget_Enabled", which, when activated, gives widgets a complete Material You design.

At the same time, this design has been drawn for some time, as Google itself demonstrated it on its blog in the same October 2021.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-03T13:52:42
item.description:
Big leak of Google Tensor 3 processor specs.

Android Authority has published the specs of the processor that the Pixel 8 will be equipped with, thanks to a source inside Google:

‚Ä¢ Layout: 4x Cortex-A510 @ 2.15GHz + 4x Cortex-A715 @ 2.45GHz + 1x Cortex-X3 @ 3.0GHz.
‚Ä¢ ARMv9 architecture
‚Ä¢ Support for Memory Tagging Extensions (MTE) by Arm.
‚Ä¢ GPU: Arm Mali-G715, 890MHz. Presumably a 10 core 'Immortalis' variant with ray tracing support.
‚Ä¢ Potential support for 8K30 video decoding/encoding in H.264 and HEVC. But this is unlikely to be included in the final device.
‚Ä¢ The Pixel 8 will be the first phone to support AV1 to 4K30 encoding.
‚Ä¢ The TPU, codenamed 'Rio', will run at 1.1GHz.
‚Ä¢ A new second-generation GXP digital signal processor (codenamed 'callisto') with a frequency increase from 975MHz to 1065MHz.
‚Ä¢ New UFS 4.0 controller from Samsung.
‚Ä¢ Modem: A 'slightly different variant' of the Exynos Modem 5300.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-01T15:59:04
item.description:
Google has announced 7 new features for Android phones, tablets and Wear OS watches.

1) Reading practice with PlayBooks ‚Äî helps new readers improve their vocabulary and comprehension skills via hearing the pronunciation of unknown words, practicing mispronounced words and receiving feedback in real time. Available on thousands of children's e-books with ‚ÄúPractice‚Äù badge.

2) New widgets for Google TV and Finance, and revamped widget for Google News.

3) Commuters in Washington, D.C. and the San Francisco Bay Area can now use their Wear OS smartwatch to tap and ride with their SmarTrip and Clipper cards via Google Wallet.

4) New tiles and shortcuts from Spotify for Wear OS. (Podcasts, Heavy rotation and AI DJ);

5) Google Keep for Wear OS can now add a tile for quick access to a selected note or to-do list.

6) New Emoji Kitchen combos with Sharkü¶à, Dolphin üê¨ and Whale üêã ;

7) 'Dark web report' is now available for most Google accounts in the US on the Google One website and app.

üîó Google Blog

item.title: 2023-05-31T21:26:10
item.description:
Google Search app adds a new "Finance watchlist" widget.

When you update to the latest beta of the Google Search app v.14.22.12.29, you will find a new widget that allows you to "follow stocks, indexes and crypto on Google Search to build a watchlist". The widget has a button to manually update the data, as well as a separate settings page.

In the settings you can choose which stocks, indices, etc. will be displayed as the topmost chart in the widget. You can select either a specific option, or the one for which there has been the biggest gain or loss.

You can also choose to sort the watchlist by name, by symbol, by % of change, and each option in ascending or descending order.

The watchlist itself can be changed at google.com/finance.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-25T18:41:15
item.description:
Android 14 Beta 2.1 bugfix has been released.

Fixed issues:

‚Ä¢ Battery percentage could still display as 0% regardless of the device's actual charge level.
‚Ä¢ Issues that sometimes caused audio disruptions with the device's speakers.
‚Ä¢ System stability issues that could cause apps or the device to freeze or crash.
‚Ä¢ An Issue with always-on-display mode when using a device with Android Auto.
‚Ä¢ Google Photos app could crash when trying to open certain photos.
‚Ä¢ An Issue with Google TV app that caused the PiP window to disappear when switching to picture-in-picture mode with gesture navigation turned on, although playback continued and sound was audible.
‚Ä¢ An Issue that caused the Google Contacts app to crash when managing account settings.
‚Ä¢ An Issue where the Google Messages app icon did not appear in notifications if Always-on-display mode was enabled.

Build: UPB2.230407.014 ‚Üí UPB2.230407.019
Patch: May 2023

‚Ä¢ OTAs
‚Ä¢ Factory Images

üîó Register for Android beta testing

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-24T18:49:44
item.description:
A bunch of new upcoming changes to the Google Contacts app:

‚Ä¢ Redesigned Call, Text, etc. buttons, which are now presented as a circle with an icon inside.
‚Ä¢ A new 'Google Maps ¬∑ Location sharing' tile, which when clicked will open a map with the contact's location (if they have shared the location with you).
‚Ä¢ A new tile will appear on the 'Highlights' tab with Suggestions for who to add to your favorites. As stated, this is "based on who you interact with most".

These hidden features complement the previous changes I discovered, such as the time and weather tile by contact's home address and the new round-frame photo display.

All of these new features are built inside the latest version 4.9.19.533509922 and require only server-side activation (means, they are not yet available).

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-24T07:00:46
item.description:
Google Chrome on Android begins work on a transparent navigation bar.

In one of the latest Chrome Canary builds, there is a new "DrawEdgeToEdge" flag, whose description says, "Enables the Android feature Edge-to-Edge to draw below the Nav Bar". After enabling this flag, the Android navigation gesture bar finally becomes transparent, as many users have requested.

But as stated in the corresponding commit on Chromium Gerrit, this is a basic implementation that is not
a suite for launch but fine for a Dev demo.

From personal observations, I can say that the transparency only affects the home and web pages, while the settings, bookmarks, etc. are still unchanged. It is also accompanied by unintentional gesture pill overlap on sites with bottom navigation bars, and the top bars are overlapped by the status bar by the height of the navbar.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-19T20:51:24
item.description:
Hands-on: I finally got this fully working, so here's a full demo of Android 14's new partial screen recording feature.

This feature lets you record a single app without any System UI elements or notifications appearing in the video! A useful feature to have when you need to screen record something to share with others!

(In the app selector dialog, you can swipe up to show the full app list. You can also swipe left or right on the carousel to show more apps from your recents app list.)

EDIT:

If you leave the app you selected to record, then Android will continue screen recording but the content will be black. If you open the app again, the contents will once again be captured in the same recording.

The recording doesn't end unless you swipe down and end it manually.

item.title: 2023-05-19T13:30:21
item.description:
Android 14 will allow you to 'save app pair' shortcut.

As Mishaal Rahman discovered, Android 14 Beta 2 added a new ENABLE_APP_PAIRS developer flag to the Pixel Launcher. If you turn it on, you will be able to 'save app pair' of two apps in split screen mode from the context menu in recents overview.

Most likely, after that a corresponding shortcut will appear on the home screen, and when you click on it, it will open the previously saved pair of apps in split-screen mode.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-18T12:40:14
item.description:
The first live video of the Pixel 8 Pro showing off the new thermometer feature has been leaked.

Kuba Wojciechowski (via 91 Mobiles) has shared a video of the Pixel 8 Pro that reveals the full design of the phone, as well as demonstrating the thermometer feature.

From a previous Pixel 8 Pro renders leak, we remember that there was an unknown sensor underneath the flash. As it turns out, it's a special infrared temperature measurement sensor. This sensor is similar to the one used in most non-contact thermometers. In the video we can see a clear demonstration of how this would work.

In addition to measuring body temperature, the Pixel 8 Pro will be able to measure the temperature of objects. The collected data will be stored locally, and it will be processed through Android Private Compute Core.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-18T11:09:55
item.description:
Android 14 will improve drag-and-drop text and media between apps.

Until now, to drag a text or media file from one app to another, you had to open them in split screen mode. And you couldn't use system navigation while dragging an object.

It looks like Android 14 will refine this point, and you'll be able to grab an object in one app, go back to the homescreen or open the recents overview, open another app and paste that object there without having to go into split-screen mode.

*Yeah, just like iOS*

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-17T22:23:05
item.description:
Port of live wallpaper from Google Pixel Fold for phones.

‚Ä¢ Author: @trzpro (via Xiaomiui resource)

‚Ä¢ Demo

Notes:
‚Ä¢ You may face Google Play Protect window pop up with a suspicious app warning.
‚Ä¢ The wallpaper does not rotate to landscape mode.
‚Ä¢ Don't expect any magic or smoothness, as this is a port from a folding device, where the progress of the animation depends on the angle of folding the device.

Google News | En
